result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Christopher Headley

records.addlTxt: THIS CASE HAS BEEN ADMINISTRATIVELY TRANSFERRED TO JUDGE ANNETTE BARNA AS JUDGE STEVE ANDERSON HAS RETIRED.

3:31 PM Defendant Chad Christopher Headley appeared by video.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Chad Christopher Headley. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County.   Court calls case and recites appearances.
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on June 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10: 30 AM Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County Defendant Chad Christopher Headley appeared by video. Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Chad Christopher Headley. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (22CM09, 22TR27, 21CF165, 21CM107, 22CM07, 21TR347, 22CM08, 22CF133, 21CF380, 22CF24) and recites appearances. 

22CF133 - Atty Sutton indicates she has not reviewed criminal complaint with DEF, requesting to hold the INIT at the end of today's hearings to allow her time to opt-in and review criminal complaint.  

22CF24 - State indicates ready to proceed and has one witness for the preliminary hearing.  10:32AM State calls Deputy Craig Depew.  Clerk swears in witness.  State questions witness.  10:43AM Witness identifies DEF. 10:44AM  Atty Sutton cross examines witness. 10:47 Atty Sutton concludes questioning.  State had no redirect.  State has no additional witnesses.  Atty Sutton has no witnesses.  State makes argument, requests bind over.  Atty Sutton has no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Court indicates bond incorrectly lists no contact with TDA, should be TDJ.  Court indicates no objections by either party to correct.  Atty Sutton indicates no objection to bond correction.

10:50AM Atty Sutton requests breakout room with DEF.  OFF THE RECORD at 10:50AM

10:54AM BACK ON THE RECORD / Appearances remain unchanged.  22CF133 -- Atty Sutton indicates waiver of formal reading, requests preliminary hearing on felony bail jump, waiving time limits.  DEF agrees.  Court finds DEF knowingly, intelligently, freely, and voluntarily waives time limits.    

Atty Sutton requests PLEAH set for all cases.  State has no objection.  Court indicates his JA will contact parties to schedule a review hearing.  DEF questions Court on signing bond, Clerk indicates bond will be held at COC window for DEF to sign.  State requests clarification on 21CM326 and 20CM323, Court indicates he will have is JA contact Washburn County.
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:04 AM Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County.  Defendant Chad Christopher Headley appeared by video, with Attorney Laura Ann Sutton. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases (21CM107, 21CF165, 22CM08, 22CF24, 22TR27, 21TR347, 22CM07, 22CM09, 21CF380) and recites appearances. 

Court indicates the following hearings are needed:  INIT in 22CM07, 22CM08, 22CF24, 22CM09 / Preliminary hearing in 21CF380 / STC in 21CM107, 21CF165, 22TR27, 21TR347.  

Initial appearances completed in 22CM07, 22CM08, 22CF24, 22CM09

State indicates bonds needed in 22CM07, 22CM08, 22CF24, 21CF380 and that bond has been set in 22CM09.  State makes bond recommendations in 22CF24, 22CM07, 22CM08, and 21CF380.   Atty Sutton has no objections, Court sets bonds.  

Regarding 21CF380, all parties are ready to proceed with preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing completed for 21CF380.  

Court sets PH for 22CF24 / ARGN for 21CF380 / STC for 21CM107, 21CF165, 22CM08, 22TR27, 21TR347, 22CM07, 22CM09 for 5/23/22 at 10:30AM so cases will continue to track together.
Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Supervision Report - Justice Point

NO CONTACT WITH: W.S. DOB: 4/28/1949
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages. May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia. No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.
Defendant entered into a secure inpatient facility on January 5, 2022 and will be unable to submit to daily drug testing with Justice Point.  Defendant shall remain in contact with Justice Point upon release from treatment and he shall make arrangements to re-establish testing with Justice Point Pre-trial Services at 10610 Main St Ste 101, Hayward, WI 54843 Phone: 715-804-0109 or 715-338-3976 for all testing.  Following end date of January 31, 2022 Justice Point has discretion to set testing requirement.
